headline: Nasdaq Joins Others in Bid for the Future of Trading. What That Means.
summary: Nasdaq wants to bring the future of trading into the present—and the exchange operator is pushing to make it happen.  On Monday,  Nasdaq  pitched digitizing assets for faster and seamless transactions in a proposal to the Securities and Exchange Commission.  Nasdaq is just the latest financial leader to want to launch securities that are “tokenized,” a buzzword these days in the world of trading.

headline: Why Strategy Stock May Never Make It Into the S&P 500
summary: Strategy missed the cut for admission into the S&P 500 Friday when three additions were announced—  AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor  —and it could be tough for the big Bitcoin holder to be chosen.  The company looks more like an exchange-traded fund or closed-end fund than an operating company with ample recurring revenue and profits.  The company’s strategy is to issue equity—mostly common stock and some preferred—and buy Bitcoin, making it a giant repository of the cryptocurrency.

headline: PNC to buy Colorado bank for $4.1 billion as part of coast-to-coast push
summary: Pittsburgh’s PNC Financial Services Group said Monday it reached an agreement to acquire Colorado lender FirstBank for $4.1 billion, moving one of the largest regional banks in the US one step closer to becoming a coast-to-coast brand.

headline: AppYea Development Update: Blockchain Infrastructure on Track for Q4 2025 Completion of Multi-Game Adaptation
summary: AppYea Inc. (OTCQB: APYP) today issued a development update on its TechLott–powered blockchain results engine, a game–agnostic layer for gaming, virtual horse racing, video games, and sweepstakes. The Company remains on track to complete the adaptation of the platform to new and additional applications during Q4 2025.

headline: Robinhood Earns an S&P 500 Seat: Milestone for the Trading App Pioneer
summary: HOOD secures a spot in the S&P 500 after record highs and a 171.7% surge this year, marking its rise from a trading app disruptor to market mainstay.

headline: Bullish will be the ‘second largest’ institutional exchange after Coinbase if it does one thing, Bernstein says
summary: Bullish to capture 8% of US institutional crypto spot by 2027, analysts say. Revenue forecast to surge 77% to $377m by 2027.
